intro: Mitesia punctata, commonly known as the Hawaiian miteia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with simple, opposite leaves that are often pubescent. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in coastal and lowland areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
